description: From French funeste, from Latin fūnestus, from fūnus (“funeral; death”).

adjectives.description: funest (comparative more funest, superlative most funest)

entries.meaning: (now rare) Causing death or disaster; fatal, catastrophic; deplorable, lamentable.
examples: I do assure you, there is nothing I have a greater scorn and indignation against, than these wretched scoffers; and I look upon our neglect of severely punishing them as an high defect in our politics, and a forerunner of something very funest.
